Technique: ROUGH-HEWN; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Hieratic ostracon
Description: This ostracon, which was purchased at Dra Abu-el Naga in 1901 by J.Capart, carries many lines of hieratic writing on its two sides, of which the majority are effaced. The text probably constitutes one list of foods and one other of materials, such as cloth and metals.
